intro: Oenothera rhombipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its showy, tubular flowers that attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Oenothera rhombipetala typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and native landscaping.
